meanings.definition: To predict or estimate (something) to be greater or more than the actual amount or outcome.
meanings.sent1: She always overpredicts the number of guests at her parties.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast overpredicts the chance of rain.
meanings.sent3: He overpredicts his ability to finish all his homework in one night.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overpredicts the reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The scale of the model city overpredicts the actual size of buildings.

meanings.definition: To make a prediction that is too high or optimistic.
meanings.sent1: The coach tends to overpredicts the team's chances of winning.
meanings.sent2: The economist overpredicts the stock market performance.
meanings.sent3: His enthusiasm overpredicts the success of his new business venture.
meanings.sent4: The fortune teller's crystal ball overpredicts good fortune for the client.
meanings.sent5: The student's confidence overpredicts the grade he will receive on the test.
